title: Strengthening Leadership Practical Competencies: Developing Instructional Design Capabilities Based on Learning Sciences: Mobile Micro-

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Learners write a report systematically diagnosing learner characteristics (three or more: personality types, learning styles) and environmental factors (three or more: home/school/social contexts) during the analysis phase and propose two or more customized learning strategies based on diagnostic results.
Apply teaching strategies based on learning science theories to actual instructional design

Learners use digital media tools (Canva, Adobe Spark, CapCut) to create three HR-applicable contents (e.g., recruitment promotions, employee training materials) and propose solutions meeting four or more of five evaluation criteria (creativity, practicality, technical completeness) from peer/instructor feedback.
Implement a process to improve instructional design by reflecting on formative assessment results

Learners plan and manage a small-scale educational project (3–5 team members) from inception to execution within six months, collect and analyze learner engagement/performance data via Excel or Google Sheets, and derive three or more insights (e.g., engagement patterns, performance correlations).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
